: OK, currently you have a onboard intel graphics card, but you wish to use your nvidia card? What is ubuntu defaulting to?
its default with intel graphics card
did u understand my problem? just want to remove intel and install nvidia card!!
: So the Nvidia is currently running and your monitor is connected via it?
i removed it, coz it will freeze ubuntu, in boot time only.........
: ah ok. I would put the nvidia card in and do a fail safe boot, then re-configure X
: Yes, normally once a AGP/PCI-E card is added the onboard card is disabled.
: All you need to do then is failsafe and reconfigure the X server with the new card.
how to do failsafe boot and others?
: when the boot loader loads, you should see, "Press f8 (or another key) for options, this will then give you a option to load the fail safe mode
oh ok, after installing nvidia drivers i need to do failsafe boot??
: Once in fail safe - type in :- sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
: Fail safe first > Reconfigure X > reboot > Then install nvidia drivers.
